alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 12:44PM EST until further notice by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Vaca Key, including the city of Marathon. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1243 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marathon, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Seven Mile Bridge, Boot Key, Knight Key, Pidgeon Key, Grassy Key, Duck Key and Key Colony Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
